org.araneaframework.framework.filter
Class StandardMessagingFilterWidget

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.core.BaseComponent
      org.araneaframework.core.BaseService
          org.araneaframework.core.BaseWidget
              org.araneaframework.framework.core.BaseFilterWidget
                  org.araneaframework.framework.filter.StandardMessagingFilterWidget
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Component, FilterWidget, MessageContext, UpdateRegionProvider, Service, Widget
public class StandardMessagingFilterWidget
extends BaseFilterWidget
implements MessageContext

Adds a MessageContext implementation to the environment that can be used to add messages for later output.

An example how to add messages to the context follows: 

 <code>
 ...
 MessageContext messageContext = getEnvironment().get(MessageContext.class);
 messageContext.addMessage(MessageContext.INFO_TYPE, "Hello message!");
 </code>

Author:
"Toomas RÃ¶mer" , Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov@araneaframework.org), Taimo Peelo (taimo@araneaframework.org)
See Also:

public void showMessage(String type,
                        String message,
                        Object... params)
Description copied from interface: MessageContext
Adds the message of given message type to the messages to be shown the user. The message will be removed from this context before the next request.

Specified by:
showMessage in interface MessageContext
Parameters:
type - The type of messages that the given message will be bound to. Can be one of, but is not limited to the ones defined MessageContext.
message - The message text to show. Can be a label that will be localized before displaying.
params - Optional parameters for the message label.

getMessages

public Map<String,Collection<MessageContext.MessageData>> getMessages()
Description copied from interface: MessageContext
Returns all messages as a Map. The keys of the Map are the different message types encountered so far and under the keys are collections of messages associated with that type.

A child service should do as follows to access the messages 

 MessageContext msgCtx = getEnvironment().requireEntry(MessageContext.class);
 Map<String, Collection<MessageData>> map = msgCtx.getMessages();
 Collection<MessageData> list = map.get(MessageContext.ERROR_TYPE);

The map could be null, if this service was not used. The collection is null, if no messages of that type been added to the messages.

Specified by:
getMessages in interface MessageContext
Returns:
A map of message types and their corresponding messages.

getResolvedMessages

public Map<String,Collection<String>> getResolvedMessages(LocalizationContext locCtx)
Description copied from interface: MessageContext
Returns all messages after resolving their values. Otherwise similar to MessageContext.getMessages().

Specified by:
getResolvedMessages in interface MessageContext
Parameters:
locCtx - The localization context that is used for resolving.
Returns:
A map of message types and their corresponding values.

getRegions

public Map<String,String> getRegions(LocalizationContext locCtx)
Description copied from interface: UpdateRegionProvider
Will be called only when update-region filter is activated on AJAX requests.

Specified by:
getRegions in interface UpdateRegionProvider
Parameters:
locCtx - Localization context for resolving region labels (e.g. in messages region). If the messages context is not rendered then probably the context is not needed.
Returns:
A map containing regions that will be passed to client-side. Map must have region names as String keys and region contents as String values. Region contents will be passed to client-side Javascript region handler, designated by region name. May return null or empty map. If map contains a null value, then that region is not included in response.

storeMessage

protected static Map<String,Collection<MessageContext.MessageData>> storeMessage(Map<String,Collection<MessageContext.MessageData>> messageMap,
                                                                                 String type,
                                                                                 String message,
                                                                                 Object... params)
Stores message of given type in given messageMap (created if null at invocation).

Parameters:
messageMap - The messages map where the message should be stored.
type - The type of message to store (one of the constants in MessageContext).
message - The message to store permanently until removed.
params - Optional parameters to be resolved in the message.
Returns:
The same message map taken as a parameter

                                                                                 MessageContext.MessageData messageData)

removeMessage

protected static void removeMessage(Map<String,Collection<MessageContext.MessageData>> messageMap,
                                    String msgType,
                                    String message)
Removes the given message from given message type in messageMap. When given type is NULL, removes the given message from all types.

                                    MessageContext.MessageData messageData)

given message map with permanent messages added.
